personalInfo.name: Mohd. Jamal Uddin Mallick Tahmid
personalInfo.title: CSE Undergrad & AI Researcher
personalInfo.bio: I am a Computer Science undergraduate at the University of Dhaka with a strong focus on AI, Machine Learning, and Full Stack Development. My research interests include Computer Vision and Deep Learning, specifically in low-light image enhancement.

thesis.title: Face Recognition in Low-Light: Enhancing Visibility with Deep Learning
thesis.description: Engineered a recognition-aware framework using a novel Discriminative Multi-Level Face Loss (InfoNCE, Triplet Margin) to preserve identity in extreme conditions (1% light).
achievements: Developed a coupled pipeline with HVI-CIDNet for restoration and frozen AdaFace for hierarchical supervision across 4 feature depths.
Designed a physics-based synthesis pipeline modeling Poisson-Gaussian noise and white balance failure to create realistic training data.
Achieved a 65% relative EER reduction and 3.2% TAR improvement at high-security thresholds (FAR=0.1%), validating increased feature separation.

projects.title: Zerobin
projects.description: Bangladesh's first AI-driven waste management platform with gamified reporting, e-waste marketplace, and predictive analytics along with computer vision pipeline using Gemini 2.5 Flash + LangChain for waste classification and fraud detection with EXIF metadata extraction, reverse image search, and AI-generated image verification.Implemented predictive ML models: LightGBM for 3-day waste hotspot forecasting and LSTM for bin overflow prevention, achieving 94.5% accuracy on fine-tuned Bangla sentiment analysis. Built full-stack platform with FastAPI backend, Next.js frontend, and LangGraph-powered agentic AI chatbot with database access and web search capabilities for citizen engagement.

hackathons.title: InnovateX 2025 Hackathon
hackathons.details: InnovateX 2025 was a three-day tech fest hosted by the University of Asia Pacific. One of the highlights was an intense 10-hour hackathon, where we developed “TryShip” — a platform aimed at bridging the gap between students and the industry. TryShip empowers freshers to gain hands-on experience by completing real-world micro tasks from industry professionals, fostering practical learning through doing.

hackathons.title: 1st S.N. Bose Science Festival 2025 Hackathon
hackathons.details:
The 1st S.N. Bose National Science Festival-2025 was a four-day event held at the University of Dhaka's Curzon Hall from May 22–25, 2025 and organized by BRAC and Biggan Adda. The Science Fest had 8 segments and among them IT Hackathon is the one that we participated.
We participated with "Proyash", a platform designed to boost science awareness among youngsters. It includes an AI Science Coach for topic explanations and assessments, a Virtual Lab for physics, chemistry, and biology simulations, Science Quests to explore challenges, Micro Missions for online data collection, and a Virtual Expo to join and compete in science fairs virtually.
